intro: Senecio krauseanus, commonly known as the Cape snowflake, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils. Senecio krauseanus is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate salt spray and coastal winds. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
